sentences.en: Better have no war for a thousand days than slacken your vigilance for one day.
sentences.cn: 宁可千日不战,不可一日不备.

sentences.en: Constant vigilance is necessary in order to avoid accidents.
sentences.cn: 为了避免意外事故,必须经常保持警惕.

sentences.en: Don't you know the crushed worm will turn ? Why are you so lacking in vigilance?
sentences.cn: 你不知道困兽犹斗 吗 ?为什么这样麻痹大意?

sentences.en: Drugs are a problem that requires constant vigilance.
sentences.cn: 需要对毒品问题长期保持警惕。

sentences.en: Guaranteeing the safety of students requires continued vigilance on the part of teachers.
sentences.cn: 要确保学生安全,教师得时常保持警惕.
他的警觉从未松懈下来.

sentences.en: It'seems to me they still have some fight left in them. We shouldn't relax our vigilance.
sentences.cn: 他们余勇可贾, 我们不能放松警惕.

sentences.en: Never relax your vigilance while you live in peace.
The maid's vigilance had always spared her the sight of such incongruities.
sentences.cn: 女仆一向非常小心,不让她看到这种使她不快的景象.

sentences.en: the need for increased police vigilance
sentences.cn: 警方加强警戒的必要性

sentences.en: The price of life is eternal vigilance.
sentences.cn: 生命的代价就是永远小心谨慎.

sentences.en: We must never relax our vigilance.
We must step up our vigilance.
We shouldn't relax our vigilance at any time.
sentences.cn: 任何时候我们都不应该放松警惕.

sentences.en: You cannot afford to relax your vigilance for a moment.
sentences.cn: 警惕性是万万不可放松的.

words.tran_cn: 警惕的；警醒的；注意的；警戒的
义务警员；治安维持会成员

trans.tran_en: careful attention that you give to what is happening, so that you will notice any danger or illegal activity
